intro: Coccoloba sarmentosa, commonly known as creeping beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its succulent, trailing stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white berries that are a food source for various birds and small mammals. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a reddish or purple hue, especially in the fall. Coccoloba sarmentosa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
